To each of the vectors v
t we associate the value I( t + 1), requiring that I( t + 1) belongs to the same segment as I( t). The association

ts( E+1) are the E + 1 smallest distances between library vectors and the vector w
t , and M is a normalizing factor. The red curve in Fig. 2a shows the correlation between I( t + 1) − I( t) and the predicted values I pred( t + 1) − I( t) as functions of the embedding dimension E. The red curve shows a low optimal embedding dimension E = 3 consistent with collapse to stable states and the blue curve shows the same analysis for the outbreak periods (defined as the 30 weeks following disease onsets) yields a higher optimal E = 9.
